channel.title: Running a server on vista possible?

item.title: Running a server on vista possible?
item.dc:creator: @my_stoof my stoof
item.description:
@my_stoof wrote:

Learn to spell.

On topic : Make it to your c; directory and create a classpath for it. Its what i had to do for my vista laptop[quote=“Scully, post:3, topic:278435”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=367465.msg2784000#msg2784000 date=1242355173]
Title says all.
[/quote]

Yes, it is possible. I’m assuming your having trouble with your PATH and CLASSPATH?

If you when you installed Java did you look at the directory it installed into?
On Windows Vista it will automatically download into the Program Files (x86) instead of the regular program files. So all you need to do is edit you PATH and CLASSPATH to make it recognize Java.[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Running a server on vista possible?

item.title: Running a server on vista possible?
item.dc:creator: @Patrickdds Patrickdds
item.description:
@Patrickdds wrote:

i have vista and i use this :

classpath : CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

path : C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13\bin;
and that works for me,

Read full topic
item.source: Running a server on vista possible?

item.title: Running a server on vista possible?
item.dc:creator: @Scully Scully
item.description:
@Scully wrote:

the elve age:

Title says all.

Yes, it is possible. I’m assuming your having trouble with your PATH and CLASSPATH?

If you when you installed Java did you look at the directory it installed into?
On Windows Vista it will automatically download into the Program Files (x86) instead of the regular program files. So all you need to do is edit you PATH and CLASSPATH to make it recognize Java.

Read full topic
